alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Cumberland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 2:15PM EDT until August 28 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties, Amelia and Cumberland. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 214 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is likely ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen during the past hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over parts of the area during the next 45 to 60 minutes. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cumberland, Amelia Courthouse, Sunnyside, Morven, Jetersville, Guinea Mills, Chula, Paineville, Rodophil, Lodore, Truxillo, Clinton, Deatonville, Grays Siding, Angola, Oak Forest, Maplewood, Ashby, McRae and Giles Mill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
